translation:
Today at around 5 o'clock in the morning, our enemies coming from Cima da Serra entered the chapel of Santa Maria, and wishing to ascertain their strength, I sent Lieutenant José Jacinto with 5 men, and in the first shots he was killed, and after observing the force, I withdrew with 10 men, which was the number of men I had; on this same date I have already notified the Illustrious Senhor João Antônio, giving him an account of what occurred; the force I could observe was about one hundred and some men; I remain at this point keeping watch over the enemy's march.

Alexandre Manuel Pereira — Captain of the National Guards Vacacaí, December 15, 1839, at 8 o'clock of the day.

It is in accordance. The captain employed at the War Secretariat. (a) Vicente Ferrer de Almeida.

Annexed to document CV-123.
